definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.chinese: 還是老老實實的買一匹真正的馬吧。

sentences.english: In addition there are much people on the beach young and old.
sentences.chinese: 另外，海灘上有許多老老少少。

sentences.english: His father had hoped Barnaby might lead a life of dim propriety.
sentences.chinese: 巴納比的爸爸希望他能老老實實地過一輩子。

sentences.english: The third group just took the test without the opportunity to cheat.
sentences.chinese: 第三組沒有作弊的機會，只能老老實實的答題。

sentences.english: Kite-flying is popular among people of all ages.
sentences.chinese: 放風箏是老老少少都喜愛的活動。

sentences.english: Why don't you go to work an' earn an honest livin', eh?
sentences.chinese: 你爲什麼不老老實實去幹活？

sentences.english: In China, many people, both young and old, gave money to help those who were in need.
sentences.chinese: 在我國，老老少少紛紛慷慨解囊，幫助災民。
他很快就使那個小偷老老實實的了。

sentences.english: People old and young love him very much.
sentences.chinese: 老老少少的人都非常喜歡他。

sentences.english: Cancer stays at home and gives candy to the other trick-or- treaters .
sentences.chinese: 巨蟹座老老實實地待在家裏等着給來搗鬼的人糖喫。

sentences.english: So you would still be right back to buying more seeds next year.
sentences.chinese: 所以你來年還是得老老實實回去買更多的種子。

sentences.english: Our honesty hope you to come to the United States back early.
sentences.chinese: 我們老老實實希望您來美國回得早。

sentences.english: Over the side, he honestly sat in a corner without saying a word.
sentences.chinese: 他上船後，老老實實坐在一個角落裏，不再做聲。

sentences.english: It was as if these men and boys had suddenly dived into past ages.
sentences.chinese: 這些老老少少，好象一下又回到了太古時代。

sentences.english: In fact, people of all ages fly kites in their free time.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，老老少少在閒暇進都很喜歡放風箏。

sentences.english: Why don't you go to work an' earn an honest livin', eh? Answer me that.
sentences.chinese: 你爲什麼不老老實實去幹活？

definition: the old and the young/the youngest member of the family

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
(old) child, particularly referring to the son who resembles his father
grandfather's sister/sister of a woman's father-in-law
organizer of a gambling party who takes a cut of the winnings/banker (gambling)/preceding player (in a game)/(dialect) boss/proprietor
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
grandpa (polite form of address for old man)
